text: Choose the set of blocks that can be put together to make the 3D figure below.
explanation:
Answer:

The correct answer is a). The block at the top of set a) is rotated 90 degrees left‑to‑right to become the block on the right‑hand side of the figure. The block at the bottom of set a) goes on the left‑hand side of the figure, at the back. The remaining block in set a) goes on top of this block.

text: Each of the figures on the left has code letters to describe it. Work out how the letters go with the figures, then choose the code for the new figure on the right.
explanation:
Answer:

The correct answer is d) (BGN). B = four‑pointed star, C = five‑pointed star, D = six‑pointed star. F = black star, G = white star, H = grey star. M = lines on the left, N = lines on the right.

Glossary (opens in new tab) >

text: Choose the option which is a top‑down 2D view of the 3D figure below.
explanation:
Answer:

The correct answer is d). There are five blocks visible from above, which rules out options e) and b). There are two blocks visible in the middle row, which rules out options a) and c).

Glossary (opens in new tab) >

text: Choose the cube which can be made from the net below.
explanation:
Answer:

The correct answer is e). Option d) is ruled out because the black triangles should be pointing towards the oval. Option c) is ruled out because the grey heart and the grey cross must be on opposite sides. Option b) is ruled out because if the grey cross is on the top and the three black triangles are on the front, then the two black triangles should be on the right. Option a) is ruled out because the oval and the three black triangles must be on opposite sides.

Glossary (opens in new tab) >

text: In the boxes below are figures with code letters. The top letters have a different meaning to the bottom ones. Work out how the letters go with the figures, then choose the code for the new figure.
explanation:
Answer:

The correct answer is d) (EZ). E = the edges of the two ovals do not overlap, F = the edges of the two ovals overlap. Y = large oval has a dotted outline, small oval has a dashed outline, Z = large oval has a dashed outline, small oval has a dotted outline.

Glossary (opens in new tab) >

text: Choose the 3D figure that has been rotated to make the 3D figure below.
explanation:
Answer:

The correct answer is b). Shape b) has been rotated 180 degrees in the plane of the screen. It has then been rotated 90 degrees towards you, top‑to‑bottom.

Glossary (opens in new tab) >

text: Choose the option that shows how the three shapes will look when they are joined by matching the sides with the same letter.
explanation:
Answer:

The correct answer is e). Option d) is ruled out because the wrong side of the rectangle is connected to the thin triangle. Option c) is ruled out because the rectangle is connected to the wrong side of the thin triangle. Option a) is ruled out because the wide triangle is connected to the wrong side of the thin triangle. Option b) is ruled out because the rectangle is not connected to the thin triangle.

Glossary (opens in new tab) >

text: Choose the option which should replace the empty square in the grid.
explanation:
Answer:

The correct answer is a). Working from left to right, the shape rotates 30 degrees clockwise and the dot alternates between black and white.

Glossary (opens in new tab) >

text: Look at how the first figure changes to become the second figure. Then choose the option which would look like the third figure if you changed it in the same way.
explanation:
Answer:

The correct answer is e). The number of sides of the black shape becomes the number of white circles. The white shape gets smaller and turns black.
